title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Trump's border czar says immigration raids will begin next week, including in Chicago

items.title: Chicago migrant community prepares for possible ICE raids after Trump takes office
items.description: Local leaders and immigrant rights groups in Chicago met Saturday morning in the Pilsen neighborhood to make sure the community is prepared.

items.title: Thousands protest in Washington against Trump as he prepares for inauguration
items.description: The march took place ahead of Trump's arrival to the nation's capital as he prepares to be sworn in on Monday.

items.title: The Disappearance of Maddi Kingsbury
items.description: When a young Minnesota mother goes missing, her sister turns to TikTok for help. "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports.

items.title: Medics under siege: 'We took this photo, fearing it would be our last'
items.description: El-Fasher's last functioning hospital records 28 deaths in the last month after being targeted by shells.

items.title: Trump says he'll likely give TikTok a 90-day extension
items.description: President-elect Donald Trump spoke on the possibility of delaying a ban less than 24 hours from when the social media app is expected to shut down.

items.description: Users in the U.S. who opened the app were greeted with a message that read, "Sorry, TikTok isn't available right now."

items.description: A message appearing for US users said a law banning TikTok had been enacted, meaning "you can't use TikTok for now".

items.title: Statue of Spanish conquistador reinstalled in central Lima
items.description: The controversial sculpture was unveiled at a ceremony marking 490 years since Peru's capital was founded.
